notes.text:
This update fixes two heap-based buffer overflows in tidy/libtidy. These vulnerabilities
could allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving
a command character in an href. (CVE-2015-5522, CVE-2015-5523)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: Heap-based buffer overflow in the ParseValue function in lexer.c in tidy before 4.9.31 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving a command character in an href.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The ParseValue function in lexer.c in tidy before 4.9.31 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving multiple whitespace characters before an empty href, which triggers a large memory allocation.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
